Core¶

RingSum¶

fabry.core.ringsum.calculate_weighted_mean¶

Calculates the weighted mean of data with standard deviation error

Parameters:
  • data (np.ndarray) – data array
  • error (np.ndarray) – standard deviation error bar for data
Returns:

weighted mean and weighted standard deviation
Return type:

tuple (numbers.Real, numbers.Real)
fabry.core.ringsum.get_bin_edges(dat, x0, y0, binsize=0.1)¶

returns equal area annuli bins for a ring image given a center and binsize

Parameters:
  • dat (np.ndarray) – pixel values for the camera image
  • x0 (numbers.Real) – x location (pixels) of the center of the image
  • y0 (numbers.Real) – y location (pixels) of the center of the image
Kwargs:
binsize (numbers.Real): smallest radial bin size (occurs at the largest bin)
Returns:bins for the ring sum in pixels
Return type:np.ndarray
fabry.core.ringsum.locate_center(data_in, xguess=None, yguess=None, maxiter=25, binsize=0.1, plotit=False, block_center=False)¶

Finds the center of a ring pattern image by preforming ringsums.

Parameters:
  • data (np.ndarray) – pixel values for the camera image
  • xguess (numbers.Real) – guess of x location of center, if None, takes data center
  • yguess (numbers.Real) – guess of y location of center, if None, takes data center
  • maxiter (numbers.Integral) – maximum number of center finding iterations
  • binsize (numbers.Real) – smallest radial binsize (occurs at the largest bin)
  • plotit (bool) – plot fitting curves
  • block_center (bool) – block center of image (600x600 on xguess,yguess) when finding center. This helps when there is a ring at the center of the image.
Returns:

x and y location of the center
Return type:

tuple (numbers.Real, numbers.Real)
fabry.core.ringsum.ringsum(data, x0, y0, binsize=0.1, quadrants=False, use_weighted=False)¶

Returns a equal annulus area ringsum centered at (x0, y0) from data

Parameters:
  • data (np.ndarray) – 2d image data
  • x0 (numbers.Real) – center location in x
  • y0 (numbers.Real) – center location in y
Kwargs:
binsize (numbers.Real): the delta r of the last annulus, default=0.1 quadrants (bool): split the ringsum into 4 quadrants to use multiprocessing, default=False use_weighted (bool): use a weighted mean, default=False
Returns:r bins, ring sum, ring sum error
Return type:tuple (np.ndarray, np.ndarray, np.ndarray)
fabry.core.ringsum.super_pixelate¶

Creates super pixels for image data

Parameters:data (np.ndarray) – 2d image data
Kwargs:
npix (numbers.Integral): integer number of pixels to create an npix x npix super pixel
Returns:New image made from the super pixels
Return type:np.ndarray

Models¶

fabry.core.models.airy_func¶

Computes the Airy function (ideal Fabry-Perot instument function) as a function of wavelength and cos(theta) with parameters d and F

$Airy = [1. + Q * sin(pi * (2d/w) * cos_th)^2]^(-1)$

$Q = (2 * F / pi)^2$

Parameters:
  • wavelength (np.ndarray) – wavelength array in nm
  • cos_th (np.ndarray) – cos(theta) array
  • d (numbers.Real) – etalon spacing in mm
  • F (numbers.Real) – etalon finesse
Returns:

evaluated airy function
Return type:

np.ndarray
fabry.core.models.doppler_calc¶

Computes the doppler broadening sigma and the new central wavelength from the doppler shift

$sigma = w0 * Sqrt[kT / mc^2]$

$w = w0 * (1 - v/c)$

Parameters:
  • w0 (numbers.Real) – unshifted wavelength in nm
  • mu (numbers.Real) – atomic mass in amu
  • temp (numbers.Real) – temperature in eV
  • v (numbers.Real) – velocity in m/s
Returns:

sigma in nm, shifted wavelength in nm
Return type:

(numbers.Real, numbers.Real))
fabry.core.models.forward_model¶

Convolves the Doppler spectrum with the ideal Fabry-Perot Airy function.

Parameters:
  • r (np.ndarray) – array of r values to compute model on
  • L (numbers.Real) – camera lens focal length, same units as r (pixels or mm)
  • d (numbers.Real) – etalon spacing (mm)
  • F (numbers.Real) – etalon finesse
  • w0 (Union[numbers.Real, list]) – central wavelength(s) in nm
  • mu (Union[numbers.Real, list]) – mass(es) in amu
  • temp (Union[numbers.Real, list]) – temperature(s) in eV
  • v (Union[numbers.Real, list]) – velocities in m/s
Kwargs:
nlambda (numbers.Integral): number of points in wavelength array, default=1024 sm_ang (bool): use the small angle approx or not, default=True
Returns:array length of r of forward model
Return type:np.ndarray
fabry.core.models.gaussian¶

Computes a gaussian for a given central wavelength, sigma and amp

$spec = amp/(sigma*Sqrt[2*pi]) * Exp[ -0.5 * (wavelength - w)^2 / sigma^2 ]$

Parameters:
  • wavelength (np.ndarray) – wavelength array to calculate spec on
  • w (numbers.Real) – central wavelength (same units as wavelength array)
  • sigma (numbers.Real) – sigma for gaussian (same units as w)
  • amp (numbers.Real) – amplitude of spectrum, default=1.0
  • norm (bool) – if true, the gaussian will be normalized, default=True to integrate to 1 over infinity then the amp factor will be multiplied
Returns:

spectrum evaluated on wavelength array
Return type:

np.ndarray
fabry.core.models.lorentzian(wavelength, w, gamma, amp=1.0)¶

Computes a lorentzian for a given central wavelength, gamma and amp

spec = (amp/(2*pi)) * [gamma / ((wavelength-w)**2 + (0.5*gamma)**2)]

Parameters:
  • wavelength (np.array) – wavelength array to calculate spec on
  • w (numbers.Real) – central wavelength (same units as wavelength array)
  • gamma (numbers.Real) – lorentzian gamma parameter
  • amp (numbers.Real, default=1.) – amplitude in addition to one that integrates spec to 1 over infinity
Returns:

spectrum evaluated on wavelength array
Return type:

spec (np.ndarray)
fabry.core.models.offset_forward_model(r, L, d, F, w0, mu, amp, temp, v, nlambda=1024, sm_ang=False, coeff=0.15)¶

Forward model with an attempt to model the ‘offset’ from nuissance lines

Parameters:
  • r (np.ndarray) – array of r values to compute model on
  • L (numbers.Real) – camera lens focal length, same units as r (pixels or mm)
  • d (numbers.Real) – etalon spacing (mm)
  • F (numbers.Real) – etalon finesse
  • w0 (Union[numbers.Real, list]) – central wavelength(s) in nm
  • mu (Union[numbers.Real, list]) – mass(es) in amu
  • temp (Union[numbers.Real, list]) – temperature(s) in eV
  • v (Union[numbers.Real, list]) – velocities in m/s
Kwargs:
nlambda (numbers.Integral): number of points in wavelength array, default=1024 sm_ang (bool): use the small angle approx or not, default=True coeff (numbers.Real): coefficient to model the relative amplitude of all the nuissance lines
Returns:array length of r of forward model
Return type:np.ndarray
fabry.core.models.peak_calculator¶

Simple peak calculator for ideal Fabry-Perot.

r_j = L * Sqrt[ ((2d/w)/(floor(2d/w)-j))^2 - 1]

Parameters:
  • L (numbers.Real) – L value, units will set return units (pixels or mm)
  • d (numbers.Real) – etalon spacing in mm
  • w (numbers.Real) – peak wavelength in nm
  • order (Union[np.ndarray,numbers.Integral]) – j order number. 0 gives order nearest center of rings, increasing j as you move out.
Returns:

the location of the peak(s)

in the same units as L with the same length as order
Return type:

Union[np.ndarray, numbers.Real]
fabry.core.models.trapezoidal_integration¶

Performs trapezoidal intergration

Parameters:
  • y (Union[list, np.ndarray]) – y data points
  • x (Union[list, np.ndarray]) – x data points
Returns:

area under the curve y(x)
Return type:

numbers.Real

Fitting¶

fabry.core.fitting.determine_fit_range(r, signal, pkr, thres=0.15, plotit=False)¶

Helper function to pick fitting range using peak guess and a threshold

Parameters:
  • r (np.ndarray) – r data
  • sig (np.ndarray) – ringsum data
  • pkr (numbers.Real) – guess for peak location
Kwargs:
thresh (numbers.Real): threshold from peak that is included, default=0.15 plotit (bools): plots the determined range for checking, default=False
Returns:list of indexes within threshold of peak guess
Return type:list
fabry.core.fitting.find_maximum(x, y, returnval=False)¶
Finds maximum location of a single peak using simple derivative method. Assumes only one
peak is in given data range.
Parameters:
  • x (np.ndarray) – x array of values
  • y (np.ndarray) – y array of values
Kwargs:
returnval (bool): Returns the value at the maximum if True, default=False
Returns:
x position of peak
if a minimum is detected, returns None
Return type:pk (numbers.Real)
fabry.core.fitting.find_maximum_3(x, y, y_sd, basename, plotit=False)¶

guass fit using multinest

fabry.core.fitting.find_peak(x, y, x_sd, y_sd, returnval=False, plotit=False)¶
Uses a gaussian fit to find maximum via scipy.odr fit is performed in x^2 space, but all conversions
are taken care of inside this function

y = A*Exp(-0.5*(x^2-x0^2)^2/sigma^4)

Parameters:
  • x (np.ndarray) – x values for fit
  • y (np.ndarray) – y values for fit
  • x_sd (np.ndarray) – standard deviation in x values (typically binsize)
  • y_sd (np.ndarray) – standard deviation in y values
Kwargs:
returnval (bool): flag for returning fit value at peak location, default=False plotit (bool): flag for plotting fit, default=False
Returns:peak location, peak location error, peak value
Return type:Tuple (numbers.Real, numbers.Real, numbers.Real)

Synthetic¶

class fabry.core.synthetic.Etalon(L, d, F)¶

Class that represents an etalon for a Fabry-Perot spectrometer

L¶

numbers.Real – focal length of lens for the camera

d¶

numbers.Real – etalon spacing

F¶

numbers.Real – finesse of etalon

calculate_emission(sensor, light_source, nprocs=4)¶

Calcultes the emission onto a sensor from a light source

Note: This uses multiprocessing for speed. Each process has a for loop
because of memory constraints if the sensor is too big.
Parameters:
  • sensor (Sensor) – represents a camera sensor
  • light_source (LightSource) – represents a light source for the Fabry Perot
kwargs:
nprocs (numbers.Integral): number of processes to use
Returns:shape matches sensor.sensor.shape
Return type:np.ndarray
classmethod from_dict(etalon)¶

Creates an instance of Etalon from a dictionary

Parameters:etalon (dict) – dictionary representing a etalon
Returns:an new instance of a Etalon
Return type:Etalon
to_dict()¶

Returns a dictionary representing itself

Returns:a dictionary representing itself
Return type:dict
class fabry.core.synthetic.LightSource(Ti, w, mu, velocity, amplitude=1)¶

A representation of a light source for a Fabry-Perot spectrometer

temperature¶

numbers.Real – temperature of the emitting ion in eV

wavelength¶

numbers.Real – wavelength of the light emitted in nm

mu¶

numbers.Real – relative mass of the ion

amplitude¶

numbers.Real – amplitude of the light emitted (you can choose your units here...)

velocity¶

VelocityProfile or numbers.Real – velocity of the emitting ion in m/s

classmethod from_dict(light_source)¶

Creates a new instance of LightSource from a dictionary

Parameters:light_source (dict) – dictionary representing a light source
Returns:LightSource
to_dict()¶

Returns a dict representing itself

class fabry.core.synthetic.Sensor(nx, ny, px_size=0.004)¶

A representation for a camera sensor for the Fabry Perot

nx¶

numbers.Integral – number of pixels in the x direction

ny¶

numbers.Integral – number of pixels in the y direction

px_size¶

numbers.Real – Pixel size in mm

x0¶

numbers.Real – x location of the center

y0¶

numbers.Real – y location of th center

sensor¶

np.ndarray – 2D array representing the sensors where each element is the count value for that pixel

R¶

np.ndarray – 2D array of radii values for each pixel

calculate_emission(etalon, light_source, nprocs=4)¶

Calculates emission from a light source through an etalon onto the sensor

Parameters:
  • etalon (Etalon) – representation of the etalon
  • light_source (LightSource) – representation of the light source
create_Rgrid()¶

Creates a 2D matrix of radii values for each pixel

Returns:np.ndarray

class fabry.core.synthetic.UniformPlasma(ne, Ti, pec, w, velocity=None, mu=40.0)¶
A representation of a uniform density and uniform Ti plasma with ion
species mu emitting light for a Fabry-Perot spectrometer
temperature¶

numbers.Real – temperature of the emitting ion in eV

wavelength¶

numbers.Real – wavelength of the light emitted in nm

mu¶

numbers.Real – relative mass of the ion

amplitude¶

numbers.Real – amplitude of the light emitted (you can choose your units here...)

velocity¶

Union[VelocityProfile,numbers.Real] – velocity of the emitting ion in m/s

ne¶

numbers.Real – electron density in cm^-3

pec¶

numbers.Real – photon emissivity coefficient (need to decide on units here)

mu

numbers.Real – relative mass of the ion

calculate_shift(velocity)¶

Calculate doppler shift from the ion velocity

Parameters:velocity (Union[numbers.Real, np.ndarray]) – velocity in m/s
Returns:np.ndarray
classmethod from_dict(plasma)¶

Creates a new instance of UniformPlasma from dict

Parameters:plasma (dict) – dictionary representation of a UniformPlasma
Returns:UniformPlasma
gaussian(wavelength, velocity)¶

Calculates doppler broadened and shifted gaussian

Parameters:
  • wavelength (Union[numbers.Real, np.ndarray]) – wavelength to calculate emission line profile
  • velocity (Union[numbers.Real, np.ndarray]) – velocity of ion for doppler shift
ion_emission(r, wavelength, cos_theta=None)¶

Calculates ion emission at a radius r for wavelengths provided

Parameters:
  • r (Union[numbers.Real, np.ndarray]) – radii to calculate ion emission at
  • wavelength (Union[numbers.Real, np.ndarray]) – wavelength to calculate emission line profile
Kwargs:
cos_theta (Union[numbers.Real, np.ndarray]): cos(theta) to project velocity onto a unit
vector an angle theta from the toroidal direction
Returns:np.ndarray
mass¶

Mass of ion in kg

sigma¶

Thermal doppler broadening

to_dict()¶

Returns a dict representation

class fabry.core.synthetic.VelocityProfile(Vmax, max_radius, length_scale, edge_scale, R0=140.0, offset=0.0)¶

Represents a edge driven velocity profile

Vmax¶

numbers.Real – maximum velocity

max_radius¶

numbers.Real – radial location of the maximum velocity

length_scale¶

numbers.Real – scale for the velocity gradient inward radially

edge_scale¶

numbers.Real – scale for the velocity edge gradient

R0¶

numbers.Real – location of the edge

offset¶

numbers.Real – offset velocity in the center

classmethod from_dict(velocity)¶

Returns a new instance of VelocityProfile from a dict

Parameters:velocity (dict) – dict reprsentation of a VelocityProfile
Returns:VelocityProfile
gaussian(r)¶

Helper function for the inward velocity gradient

Parameters:r (Union[numbers.Real], np.ndarray]) – radii to evaluate at
Returns:np.ndarray
right_edge_profile(r)¶

Helper function for the edge profile

Parameters:r (Union[numbers.Real, np.ndarray]) – radii to evaulate at
Returns:np.ndarray
to_dict()¶

Returns a dict representation of the VelocityProfile

Returns:dict

class fabry.core.synthetic.UniformPlasma(ne, Ti, pec, w, velocity=None, mu=40.0)
